channel.title: Extreme Big Brother
channel.description:
There's some crazy shiz going down, I was just looking for news and found out that the UK government is planning a huge database that would hold details of all phone calls, text messages, emails and internet use of every UK citizen. I mean what the hell? If this happens I am going to move country.
THE GOVERNMENT is indulging in fantasies of a massive database with details of every telephone call, text message, email and web visit made by everyone in Britain, according to The Times newspaper today. The government has run plans for the database by industry, even though they haven't yet been shown to parliament or the public, it said. The database was being touted as the engine of reforms being proposed in the government's draft Communications Data Bill. But the government's draft legislative programme gave scant details when it was published last Tuesday. It gave little more than a vague statement about the need for the police and security agencies to collect data about people's communications in order to catch terrorists and criminals....
Follow the links for the rest of the story. http://www.theinquirer.net/gb/inquirer/news/2008/05/20/uk-mulls-big-brother-comms http://business.timesonline.co.uk/tol/business/industry_sectors/telecoms/article3965033.ece What do you think about this crazy shit? I personally don't believe it would be allowed as it's insane.

I truly hope someday I can make a few million and buy my own small island.
Escape all of this daily crap.

What about Sealand, and you can earn money by let The Pirate Bay have servers there.
[/quote]

even though it is a island it is most likely already under the rule of some type of government. Therefore there are laws.[/quote]
No, Sealand is not under a another government.
You can read about it here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principality_of_Sealand

item.title: Extreme Big Brother
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Quote from a comment on this page:

http://www.theinquirer.net – 20 May 08

UK mulls big brother comms database | TheINQUIRER

Got your number, and the number you dialled,Security ,

Who precisely are these officials?

I want names; I want addresses; I want telephone numbers; I want email addresses;

I want all their correspondence and activities both written and electronic conducted over the last 12 months available to all who wish to see them.

Let’s see if they like it.

Read full topic
